problem_statement: The current Node.js chat service is designed as a monolithic, stateful application where all room memberships and message broadcasts are handled within the local memory of a single process. This implementation prevents horizontal scaling; if the application is deployed across multiple containers or nodes, users connected to 'Server A' cannot receive messages sent by users on 'Server B'. To support a multi-node production environment, the messaging logic must be decoupled from the local instance state. You are required to refactor the provided code to use a Redis-based Publish/Subscribe (Pub/Sub) architecture, ensuring that messages are correctly propagated across the entire cluster regardless of which instance a client is connected to.
